logs.question: Where should you pay attention while walking underneath for personal safety?
options: A. Shell cleaning area
B. Anchor and chain area
C. Ship support structures
D. Fire line under pressure area
logs.explanation: You should be cautious around ship support structures.

logs.question: Which of the following situations requires caution due to high-pressure water jets?
options: A. Shell cleaning
B. Handling anchors and chains
C. Using fire line under pressure
D. Operating CO2
logs.explanation: Shell cleaning with high-pressure water jets can be dangerous.

logs.question: What safety measure is crucial when dealing with direct impact of high-pressure water?
options: A. Proper communication and coordination
B. Warning notices
C. Exercise vigilance during lowering anchors and chains
D. Ensuring fire line under pressure/fire fighting appliances are ready
logs.explanation: Direct impact of high-pressure water on the body requires safety measures to prevent accidents.

logs.question: What should be done during handling to avoid accidents?
options: A. Take note of ship support structures while walking underneath for personal safety
B. Exercise caution during shell cleaning with high-pressure water jets
C. Direct impact of high-pressure water on the body can be dangerous; safety measures are crucial
D. Ensure proper communication and coordination
logs.explanation: Proper communication and coordination is necessary to avoid accidents during handling.

logs.question: What is the purpose of warning notices?
options: A. To inform about shell cleaning procedures
B. To provide guidance on using high-pressure water jets
C. To ensure safety during anchor and chain operations
D. To alert crew members about fire line under pressure/fire fighting appliances
logs.explanation: Warning notices are used to alert crew members about potential hazards, including fire line under pressure/fire fighting appliances.

logs.question: Which item is related to fire safety on a ship?
options: A. Ship support structures
B. High-pressure water jets
C. Warning notices
D. Fire line under pressure/fire fighting appliances
logs.explanation: Fire line under pressure/fire fighting appliances are used for fire safety on a ship.

logs.question: What is CO2?
options: A. A type of shell cleaning chemical
B. A high-pressure water jet component
C. A warning notice
D. A fire suppression gas
logs.explanation: CO2 is a fire suppression gas.

logs.question: Why should anchors and chains be lowered with vigilance?
options: A. To avoid accidents during communication and coordination
B. To ensure the proper use of high-pressure water jets
C. To take note of ship support structures while walking underneath for personal safety
D. To lower them carefully as they can be dangerous
logs.explanation: Anchors and chains should be lowered with vigilance because they can be dangerous.

logs.question: Which safety measure is crucial during the direct impact of high-pressure water?
options: A. Exercise caution during shell cleaning with high-pressure water jets
B. Exercise vigilance when anchors and chains are being lowered
C. Ensure proper communication and coordination to avoid accidents during handling
D. Ensuring fire line under pressure/fire fighting appliances are ready
logs.explanation: Exercise caution during shell cleaning with high-pressure water jets is a crucial safety measure when dealing with direct impact of high-pressure water.
